column4: how do I turn off desktop switching when I scroll with the mouse wheel?
don't place the pointer in the desktop switcher?
if the mouse pointer is over the desktop and I scroll with the mouse it switches desktop, very annoying - I'd love to turn it off
about your issue, I don't know. Maybe because you have desktop effects or something?
I do have desktop effects turned on, I like the wobly windows.
well you should probably mention that. Well I don't know. I don't use it. It's probably possible.
I just scrolled and realized they suggested you the compiz manager or something.
yeah, I tried turning it off, but it didn't help
prolly means I need to logoff/logon or something, I guess
used to find the setting in the window manager settings, I think
sure, logoff and then tell us if it worked.
you can always add new workspaces, right click on the switcher.
tried that, didnt' work-  the preferences only show how many columns/rows to display, didn't offer to create additional workspaces for me
oddly, if I switched off my desktop effects, my workspaces appeared. re-enabling the desktop effects (so far) have not removed the extra workspaces. very odd
if you can reproduce that, you might want to call it a bug and report it to package in launchpad
ok, after logoff and logon, everything works like I want it to. thanks
he I just posted something when you left. I said that if you think you can reproduce that you could fill or search for a bug report or something in launchpad.
I'll see what I can do
